page.title: 05National Stud
page.content: Near the hamlets of Sandley and Bugley,100 years ago flourished Compton Stud.The silver medals it awarded to breeders can still be seen. Later it was owned by Lord Furness.A piece of stone statuary placed by him in the centre of the main yard is still in place.During the second world war the then National Stud was moved to Sandley from Tully in the Republic of Ireland.Under the Director Mr.Peter Burrell the stud was extended from 180 to 400acres.The original boxes in the main yard were of timber and in 1946 they were rebuilt in brick.The unusual weathervane depicting a stork carrying a foal was added above the main block at this time.
